725272f-a.title: Queens: 38th Avenue - Union Street
725272f-a.text:
38th Avenue, at, and adjoining the N.W. corner of Union
Street. Adjoining the corner is the Macedonian African
Methodist Episcopal Church.
C.A (3,
P. L. Sperr  April 8, 1927

725273f-b.title: Queens: 38th Avenue - Union Street
725273f-b.text:
38th Ave. (Lincoln St., also Ailantus Place), south side, east
of Union St., showing in the right foreground No. 197 38th Ave..
owned by Chris Louveree in 1873; next is the First Congre.P tional
Church; and beyound it, at the S. E. corner of Boune St. and
38th ,Ave., is the M:. B. Parsons Lstate. View Ho. two is the same
showing partially the N. W. corner of 38th Ave and Bowne St.;
No thr e shows the west side of Bowne St. viewed northward.
The congregation of the church seen in this view was formed in
1851 and the edifice erected in 1856 at a cost of 14,000 dollars
on a site donated by the Parsons fanily. The first church of this
congregation was dedicated on January 29, 1852 and stod on the
east side of nion St, south of 38th Ave. When the present
building was erected, the old one was moved to the rear of it
and used as a Sunday School. It has since been abolished.

725274f-a.title: Queens: 38th Avenue - Union Street
725274f-a.text:
Thirty-eighth Avenue (No. 194 Lincoln Avenue) north side,
between Union and Bowne Streets, showing a closeup of Mrs. Cameron's
house.
January 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
